attributes.action: refuse funding for the Croxley Rail Link and ensure the proposed project is scrapped
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Met Line currently runs to Cassiobury Park on Watford’s Outskirts. The TfL plan, to divert all services East from Croxley and onto the disused rail line to Watford High St, dual tracking it and linking up West Watford, creates a number of very important issues that will affect the local community at an outrageous cost of over £100M to us, the tax payers.
The closure of the Watford Met Station will result in local people having to use their cars to travel. A greater effect will be on students attending Watford Grammar School who commute from towns such as Rickmansworth, Chorleywood & Harrow.
The joining up of the Met Line and the main line railway will also cause concern for the local community. There would also be an extremely tight bend on the proposed viaduct from Baldwins Lane over the A412 by the Two Bridges at Croxley. Trains, including freight trains, running every 10 minutes, would make awful screeching noises (metal wheels on metal tracks) all night.
The amount of time and tax payers money that has been wasted in Consultants over the years without any forthcoming firm commitment that it will ever be constructed, has to stop.
Please abandon the Croxley Rail Link
